intro: Melampodium moctezumum, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its bright yellow to orange flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Melampodium moctezumum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
